ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5h
1 to 2 hours, and about 6 hours studying for exams
3 hours
5 to 6

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It provided a thorough overview of phase 3 clinical trials and various designs for how clinical trials are performed.
Interesting and helpful
Good and useful.
The course was well-organized; both the textbook and notes were accessible and provided a good outline/structure of the course material.

The professor explained the materials very clearly and answered our questions with great examples. I would like to hear more about how clinical trial are done in the real world and the interesting stories.Please be more clear on the format of the evaluation earlier in the course so we can have more time to prepare for it.
Great course. Would have like more technical details about performing the study designs.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very good
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  N/A
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  n/a
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Unable to evaluate
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Peter is very experienced in this field and he is an excellent speaker.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Very knowledgeable and sensible.

Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  The instructor is very knowledgeable about the subject matter and is always able to provide real world examples of topics. He is very approachable and eager to involve students in discussion.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Great lecturer. Would have like covering more material.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Tae Hyun Jung  TA graded HWs and did not teach.
Instructor: Tae Hyun Jung  responsible
Instructor: Tae Hyun Jung  TA is very good
Instructor: Tae Hyun Jung  Nice, willing to help.
Instructor: Tae Hyun Jung  Very nice.
Instructor: Tae Hyun Jung  Did not give feed back on home works and interacted with him barely so unable to evaluate him.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is a good in-depth view into phase 3 randomized clinical trials. Yes, I would recommend this course if you are interested in regulatory affairs, working with clinical trials in the future or if you want a thorough understanding of different ways clinical trials are designed, how data is interpreted and caveats of clinical trials.
Highly recommend if you want to have a brief picture of clinical trials
Principle of RCT.
A good course to learn about clinical trials. The instructor is very experienced in the topics taught.

Yes I would recommend this course. Informative and with the right pace so we have enough time to absorb the material. Of course I love it that the professor gave us the book for free! I agree knowledge should befree.
Great intro course in clinical design studies. Would definitely recommend.
